text:
An empirical probability is established by analyzing past data. An a priori probability
is determined using a formal reasoning and inspection process. A subjective probability
is the least formal method of developing probabilities and involves the use of personal
judgment. An analyst may know many things about a firm's performance and have
expectations about the overall market that are all used to arrive at a subjective
probability, such as, “I believe there is a 70% probability that Acme Foods will
outperform the market this year.” Empirical and a priori probabilities, by contrast, are
objective probabilities.
